oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different kinds of rain. The children to hide from rain that is likely to be strong, for fear of the lightning. (L VIII.-9. 6813 rev.-6815 rev.). Liquid rain falls gently, a big rain falls in hard streams, another rain 'makes lightening' and makes the place black. 1) This story is found in Book VIII-9.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kinds of rain
